intro: Tecoma ipe f. lepidota, commonly known as the silverleaf glorybower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features lance-shaped, dark green leaves with a silvery underside, giving it its common name. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its rapid growth and ability to produce abundant flowers make it a striking addition to tropical and subtropical landscapes.
